unitControlModule.unitWrappers

Class PlayerUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaGOAP.GoapUnit
      • unitControlModule.unitWrappers.PlayerUnit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javaGOAP.IGoapUnit, RetreatUnit
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerUnitTypeFlying, PlayerUnitTypeMelee, PlayerUnitTypeRanged

    public abstract class PlayerUnit
extends javaGOAP.GoapUnit
implements RetreatUnit
    PlayerUnit.java --- Wrapper for a player unit. All Player Units derive from this.
    Author:
    P H - 20.02.2017

      • hollowUpdatesEnabled

        private boolean hollowUpdatesEnabled
        Flag for enabling / disabling hollow updates. If this flag is set, calling the update function has no effect. This can be used if the GoapAgent's update function has to be called twice for the underlying FSM to work properly and not wanting to create unnecessary CPU overhead by doubling the amount of performed calculations.

      • sortByDistance

        private java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> sortByDistance(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> inputList)
        Function for sorting a given List of Units based on their distance towards the current instance's Unit.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the provided List's instance sorted based on the different Unit distances towards the current one calling this function.

      • reassignUnitReferences

        private void reassignUnitReferences(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> sortedList)
        Function for reassigning the different types of enemy Unit references based on different criteria. The provided List must contain a selection of Units that can be chosen by this one as targets or ones to generally react to. This function will take the first matching Unit found in the provided List. Therefore the order in which the Units are places in the List matters!
        (-> Sort by distance to make the executing Unit always choose the nearest possible match for each criteria!)
        Parameters:
        sortedList - the List from which the different Unit references are being taken if they match the criteria.

      • generateAttackableEnemyUnitToReactTo

        protected bwapi.Unit generateAttackableEnemyUnitToReactTo()
        Function for generating / finding the Unit that this one has to react to when taking any offensive actions. The Unit has to chose between different kinds of Units in it's surrounding like workers or centers.
        Returns:
        the Unit that this one should react to when taking offensive actions.

      • generateAttackingEnemyUnitToReactTo

        private bwapi.Unit generateAttackingEnemyUnitToReactTo()
        Function for generating / finding the Unit that this one has to react to when taking any defensive actions.
        Returns:
        the Unit that this one should react to when taking defensive actions.

      • generateModifiedConfidence

        protected double generateModifiedConfidence()
        Function for generating a modified version of the standard confidence. This function utilizes the generateConfidence() method that is implemented by the Subclasses and applies a modifier to it that is based on the distance of the Unit to the nearest (center) building/-s. Using this method it is possible for the Unit to react to it's defensive surroundings, either defending them (centers) or fighting near them (bunkers).
        Returns:
        the modified confidence of the Unit that takes various other factors into account like the distance to certain buildings and locations.

      • generateConfidence

        protected abstract double generateConfidence()
        Function for generating the confidence of the Unit which determines if it attacks an enemy Unit / building, retreats to another player Unit or takes a completely different action.
        Returns:
        the base confidence of the Unit.

        protected bwapi.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> generatePlayerAndEnemySupportStrengths()

      • generatePlayerAndEnemyStrengths

        protected bwapi.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> generatePlayerAndEnemyStrengths(java.util.HashMap<bwapi.TilePosition,java.lang.Integer> playerHashMap,
                                                                                        java.util.HashMap<bwapi.TilePosition,java.lang.Integer> enemyHashMap)
        Used to determine the strength of the PlayerUnits and the enemies by summing up their representative TileValues in the confidence radius around the Unit.
        Parameters:
        playerHashMap - the HashMap which provides the Player's values that are going to be added together.
        enemyHashMap - the HashMap which provides the enemy's values that are going to be added together.
        Returns:
        the strength of the Player and the enemy in the PlayerUnit's confidence range.

      • updateConfidenceState

        protected void updateConfidenceState()
        Mostly used to reset the action Stack if the current confidence of the PlayerUnit decreases too much.This ensures, that the Unit is retreating when the tides of the battle turn in a unfavorable position.

      • updateCurrentRangeState

        protected void updateCurrentRangeState()
        Function for updating the currentRangeState of the Unit. Is separated from actOnUnitsKnown() due to some Units needing to change the implementation.

      • checkForUnresolvedIssue

        private void checkForUnresolvedIssue()
        Function for checking for an unresolved issue that the Unit is currently experiencing. This can be i.e. the Unit being stuck or idling. Therefore a check must be performed so that the actions of the Unit are reset. This effectively causes the Unit to search for a new / other / same goal to pursue with a new set of actions.
        Note:
        This is necessary since either an action of an Unit does not work correctly or a command passed to the BroodWar-API did not execute. Therefore a "hard reset" is necessary to ensure that Units i.e. do not stand in the base idling.

      • updateBaseLocationsSearched

        protected void updateBaseLocationsSearched()
        Update the searched BaseLocations if the unit is in the range of one of them.

                                  java.lang.Integer tileRadius)
        Test if a Unit is near another TilePosition
        Parameters:

        a HashSet of Units which are the centers of the initial HashSet that this Unit can attack.

      • getAttackableUnitsWithWeapons

        public java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> getAttackableUnitsWithWeapons(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for extracting enemy Units that have either a ground or air weapon from a provided HashSet of Units that this Unit can attack.
        Parameters:
        units - the Units which the enemy Units are being extracted from.
        Returns:
        a HashSet of Units which are the enemy Units with weapons of the initial HashSet that this Unit can attack.

      • getAttackableUnits

        public java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> getAttackableUnits(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for extracting enemy Units that this Unit can attack (Flying, non flying) based on this Unit's weapon.
        Parameters:
        units - the Units which the attackable Units are being extracted from.
        Returns:
        a HashSet of attackable Units (Flying, non flying) of the initial HashSet based on this Unit's weapon.

      • getAttackingUnits

        public java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> getAttackingUnits(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for getting the enemy Units in the provided HashSet that can attack it. This does NOT include their specific weapon range, but only the TYPE of weapon that they use. I.e. this function returns all enemies with ground weapons that can attack a ground Unit. If the Unit is airborne the function returns all enemy Units with air weapons that can attack flying Units.
        Parameters:
        units - the Units which the attacking Units are being extracted from.
        Returns:
        a HashSet of enemy Units of the provided HashSet that can attack the Unit itself based on it's state (Flying, not flying).

      • hasWeapon

        public boolean hasWeapon(bwapi.Unit unit)
        Function for checking if the provided Unit has either an air or a ground weapon to attack with.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit has either an air weapon or a ground weapon, otherwise false.

      • canAttack

        public boolean canAttack(bwapi.Unit unit)
        Function for testing if the Unit can attack a given Unit. This takes the current Unit's weapon into account (Ground, air).
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that this Unit's weapons are being tested against.
        Returns:
        true if this Unit can attack the given one with it's weapons.

      • canBeAttackedBy

        public boolean canBeAttackedBy(bwapi.Unit unit)
        Function for testing if the Unit can be attacked by a given Unit. This takes the provided Unit's weapon into account (Ground, air).
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit whose weapons are being tested against this Unit.
        Returns:
        true if this Unit can be attacked by the given one.

      • generateClosestCenterDistance

        public java.lang.Integer generateClosestCenterDistance()
        Function for extracting the distance to the closest Player center building on the map. This function either returns the actual distance casted to int or null, if no center building is found.
        Returns:
        the smallest distance to the therefore closest center building casted to int or null if none is found.

      • getClosestCenter

        public bwapi.Unit getClosestCenter()
        Function for extracting the center Unit that is the closest one to the current PlayerUnit's Position.
        Returns:
        the closest center Unit.

        protected abstract StateFactory createFactory()
        Function for defining the StateFactory that will be used to determine the available actions, the world-and goal-states as well as the associated updaters.
        Returns:
        the StateFactory that will be used for this PlayerUnit instance.

        true if the confidence is below the set threshold, otherwise false.

      • isConfidenceAboveThreshold

        Function for testing if a confidence is above the set threshold.
        Returns:
        true if the confidence is above the set threshold, otherwise false.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Function for reseting all actions, values and references associated with the PlayerUnit instance. This function should only be called when the reference to this instance is discarded and therefore not being used anymore.

      • manuallyResetActions

        public void manuallyResetActions()
        Function for manually resetting all current actions of the PlayerUnit. This is the equivalent of the Unit itself calling the GoapUnit.resetActions() function. Therefore this function should not be excessively used!

      • isInvulnerable

        public boolean isInvulnerable()
        Function for testing if the Unit itself is currently invulnerable. This is the case if the Unit is burrowed or cloaked and no enemy detector Unit is near it. Therefore no enemies are able to attack it => Invulnerable.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is invulnerable and not attackable, false if not.

      • isInvulnerable

        public static boolean isInvulnerable(bwapi.Unit unit)
        Convenience function.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is invulnerable and not attackable, false if not.
        See Also:
        isInvulnerable(Unit, int)

      • isInvulnerable

        public static boolean isInvulnerable(bwapi.Unit unit,
                                     int tileRange)
        Function for testing if an Unit is currently invulnerable. This is the case if the Unit is burrowed or cloaked and no detector Unit of the other Player is near it. Therefore no enemies are able to attack it => Invulnerable.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be checked.
        tileRange - the range in tiles that a possible enemy detection Unit must be in.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is invulnerable and not attackable, false if not.

      • isDetected

        public static boolean isDetected(bwapi.Unit unit)
        Convenience function.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is in the given tile range of an enemy detection Unit.
        See Also:
        isDetected(Unit, int)

      • isDetected

        public static boolean isDetected(bwapi.Unit unit,
                                 int tileRange)
        Function for checking if the Unit is near an enemy detection Unit. This function can be applied to either side since it compares the Player of the provided Unit with the one of each checked Unit.
        Note:
        This function is only necessary due to the default implementation of the "isDetected" function not working properly!
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be checked.
        tileRange - the range that a possible enemy detection Unit must be in for this function to return true.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is in the given tile range of an enemy detection Unit.
